Named Pagodes after the towers of the Chateau, this 2nd label from Estournel lives up to what you‚Äôd expect from a great 2nd growth. 46% Merlot, 44% Cab Sav, 6% Cab Franc, 4% PV, built for the mid term (8-15 years). Deep ruby in colour. Cigar box, leather and clove on the nose ‚Äî very intense! Ripe fruit, cassis as well.

On the palate, firm tannins, medium acidity and medium+ body. Well-balanced. Outstanding quality.

A beautiful nose after a 90 minute decant. Notes of blackberry, black cherry, sandalwood, graphite, and a little sweet tobacco. 

Palate shows blackberry, black currant, tobacco, pencil lead, a touch of chocolate, some minerals, and a little oak. Feels polished. Medium to medium plus bodied, dry, medium plus acidity, good tannin structure. A very well done wine. 92-93/100 points.

Second label of an Iconic winery, this is a vintage pretty weird and twisted, but attractive: a succulent wine, ripe with rich in fruit. It is soft, but with a firm core that keeps the structure together. It has the fine juiciness that coming probably from the vintage, the tannin take a supporting role to the powerful fruit. It is fresh and vivid with dark berries, dark plums and spices. Full-bodied, balanced and creamy with beautiful flavors and structure. Needs a lot of patience to really open.

Wow, really blown away by this SE. green pepper, leather, earth, and a hint of rubber combine for a complex and intriguing nose.

On the palate, fairly tannic with a really nice texture. Rose and manure combine with bing cherry to form a deliciously earthy palate. Very ripe fruit on this one, but there are some nice green pepper notes to compliment. 

Overall I‚Äôm very impressed, not abrasive or thin for a French Wine, and this character driven warmth carries from the nose to the palate to the finish.

93: great wine for the price. Very smooth. Lacks some of the depth and flavor of the 1st label. For this label; they use 30% new French oak barrels instead of 60% like the 1st label.

Really great now. On the point!!! Cherries, red berries, great length and complexity!
I am happy that my last experience was - as expected - just a default bottle.
Tried three second labels over lunch, by far this is the best. Well balanced, integrated tannins, deep sense of the Cos traditions and long finish. Good value.
The body of Marlyn Monroe, the sophistication of Marlene Dietrich and the depth of Loch Ness. Tasty as you like. Wazza. Hoofing.

Really balanced from start to finish.  Loads of citrus but otherwise only showed black and red fruits without many of the secondary flavors I expected.  Really nice bottle for someone who is looking to explore Bordeaux but isn‚Äôt accustomed to strong acidity.

Viva la France M√∂venpick winetasting #1. As new 2015 vintage of Bordeaux has arrived, this time we focused mostly on red.   This wine shows a bit more age and develops very nice. On the nose intensive deep ripe fruits - plums and cherries, vanilla, chocolate, notes of lacorice, with developing mushrooms and tabacco. Like this.  It is a little tight and I will revisit but this has nice tannin structure and length.   Red fruit and tar.   Nice but will see with a little more bottle age
Absolutely loved this Saint-estephe. Big bold and complex wine, oak, red and dark fruits, earthy tobacco and truffle.The flavours are so complex I am sure this will develop into a superstar.
A nice wine. Quite herbal on the nose, but nice palate of menthol, spice, fruit forward with blackberry and blackcurrant.
4.1.  Not very oaky, but this is pretty good, even if it is 2013.
Wife n daughter likes.. medium robust with decent amounts of tannin and acidity.  Mellowed as the nite wore on. Oak ripe cherry with cheese and hints if leather on the end.. semi dry..
Complex mix of fruit, chocolate and spice. Complex but smooth with a dry finish. Very surprised that a wine of this quality was an airline option. Emirates really have a quality service.
Mint, cherry, vanilla and leather really come together beautifully with a great finish. Quite a perfume aroma with a little acidity. Decanted and aerated for 2 hours prior to drinking
Light body, acidic and bright in the begining, finish with a herbal and spicy notes, bloodorange, black tea
Too tannic and still very young. Still closed - taste is a little flat. Very far from the first label.

Wafts of black currant and oak on the nose. Tannins are still vibrant and the finish is subtle, but I was expecting more complexity from 16 y.o. wine. 
It‚Äôs still v. good but not great‚Ä¶yet.
Strong nose, acidic, black fruit, plum, ash, oak, cedar. Easy drinking, medium tannins and long finish. Not fully mature.
Blackberry, vanilla, oak and pepper
Deep red, bouquet of black berries and blue cheese...and violet. Earthy, with diminishing fruit, mild tannins and quince skin end. Smooth. Flint coming through at the very end.
Young, fruity, vibrant, vivid... perfect! OH my GOD! Great wine with a fabulous pedigree! This is THE SHIT!
Leather, Forrest floor, ripe black fruits, dark plum, camphor, licorice, cigar box, toast, cinnamon, and malt sugar. Rich and dense, fleshy, structured, lengthy finish; good bargain!
Need to decant perhaps at least an hour to open up beautifully, balanced tannin and acidity, smooth, cedar wood, tobacco, subtle but lingering oak, very elegant, my kind of meditational wine.
Aged well, can use another 3 years, powerful and deep, wonderful medium oak.
Nice and young, would like to give it 5 more years at least!
Excellent wine. Started very closed with aromas of egg shells. Opened up later with fresh and vibrant flavors of blackberry and vanilla. Great structure with nice medium long finish!
4.24 lovely example of Bordeaux left bank complexity balanced with power and finesse. Pronounced nose with super savory tertiary notes. Something for the new world wines to aspire to
Earth, spice and black cherry scents. Medium body and a fresh plum and cherry finish. Excellent wine, though not the best one from this prestigious winery. Have been there on visit/tasting
Stunner. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot blend. Wonderfully balance, good length and smooth tannins. Red fruit, blackcurrant, tobacco and graphite. Drinking well now, go for it.
A very nice wine. Did the whole decanter thing, a really rich colour deep red. The aroma is fruity strong hint of vanilla, with a peppery edge. The taste is dry and fruity nice
Dark purple with aromas of spice and leather. A bit flinty with structured tannins. Really excellent and better after an hour decant.

better than i expected and very evolving. strong acidic back bone. earthy.  not quite ripe red plum.
Clear, medium ruby. Clean, medium intensity aroma of black fruit, cedar, licorice. Dry, high acidity, high tannins, full body and medium finish. Palate confirms the nose.
Charming nose of black currant, blackberries, hint of cherries, and then cigar box and an oaky finish. Dry and tannic with vibrant freshness. Maybe a bit thin but still really fine. 91p

Rojo profundo brillante.
Much√≠sima fruta con notas a frambuesa y frutilla, con ligera madera acompa√±ando.
La entrada en boca es fresca con menta en aroma refrescante. Taninos dulces y final largo y especiado
Potente, complexo, fruta, aroma firme, jovem, intenso, chocolate amargo, mais pot√™ncia e intensidade, menos eleg√¢ncia.
This wine has strong body, it is dry enough, you can feel some tanin. Light flavors of peppers and berries. Quite overpriced in restaurants, I drank one for 260¬£!

Classic St Estephe at the peak. Complex aromas of bruised black and red fruits, graphite, leather and coffee. Cabernet Franc influence is evident and charming. Almost full bodied, perfect balance and structure, mature tannins, sophisticated flavors, delicious finish.

Open and complex nose. Lots of information. Oak, blackberry, forest floor,  pepper, licorice, menthol, red fruit. Delightful ripe blackberry finish, perfect balance between tannins and acidity: both are pronounced and very present, but in such a pleasant way... A big body, plenty of power, but never overwhelming. 6 sec PAI. Just... YES!

Raspberries and cassis blossom between hints of leather and spicies. Tannins smoothed by age involved by rippened berries flavour. Second wine of Cos D'Estournel, this wine is a great choice to match a good steak.

Dark muddy brown. Strong gravel and mineral on the nose with plummy tannins on the nose. Smooth with feathery tannins on the tongue filled with sensory oak which makes this wine complex and layered. it feels as if it just slides down ur throat with a story left over in your mouth. This wine creates an exceptionally imaginative image. .

This wine is a great example of the classic Claret style - very smoky, feral, and full of rich dark fruit with gripping tannins. On the nose, I get intense notes of black and purple fruit, cassis and anise, fragrant juniper and lavender, and deep earth notes - all enveloped by incense. The palate is really sensual and earthy, with the smoky notes of black cherry and plum really carrying through - and supported by intense tannins. Smoky, lingering finish - suggesting this wine could age for up to 20 years.

Given more time to breathe this time around. 4 hours. As good if not better than the ‚Äò11. Mature dark fruit and sugared strawberry through the palate. End with a hint of petrol, perfect Bordeaux from an exquisite year.

This second wine of Cos d'Estournel is a very much ok wine, but not spectacular.  It shows coffee, tobacco,  pepper, oak and black fruit. Good bqlancd and structure,  medium(+) flavour intensity and finish.

The first bottle of the 2005 Bordeaux futures that I've opened.  50/50 Cab/merlot. Very easy to drink with cherry and coffee notes. Nice cedar nose.  Will be drinking more of this over the coming months.

Opened 2020.  Was harsh out of bottle, let sit for half hour.  Nose has strawberry, plum, blueberry. Front is dry, blueberry, plum, mainly dark fruit, but a hint of strawberry.  Rolls with soft tannins and slight hint of alcohol.  Fades with leather and plum.  Finish is not super long.  Great wine at this price.

Strong showing of this second one, though admittedly more advanced than I would have expected. Notes of cassis, plum, fig, cherry, sweet tobacco, smoked meats, and sage. Tannins and body are medium, as is acidity. 

93 points

Very good Bordeaux with a dark purple color in the aroma and taste, mainly dark fruit in the background red fruit palpable dried fig prune raisins notes of oak earthy spice ageing yeasty.  Bordeaux well-balanced with a pleasant tannin, dry, expressive with a long fruity finish, good wine with ripening cheeses.  üçáüç∑üç∑üëçüèªüòÉüëåüèª

Very Bordeaux! Well aged that doesn't look its age. Graphite, earthy and whiff of barnyard marks the bouquet. On the palate, Vanilla, oaks and cassis and dark chocolate with supple tannins and a long leather finish. 
While it may feels over the top now, but I think it still packs a punch to be savoured over the next few years.

I would sit this 2nd wine among the best, affordable wines you can find, along with sarget and alter ego. Aromas of plum, strawberries and freshness is due to the use of younger vines in the wine with a higher percentage of merlot giving roundedness to the taste. I would suggest letting the wine air in the glass for about 15 minutes before serving. But really good, one of my favourites!

This bottle was a gift. 
We enjoyed it at Ruth‚Äôs Chris Steakhouse with a great filet and lobster. It paired brilliantly. We did not decant, but allowed it to breathe in glass and bottle for 10-15 minutes.
It is full bodied, rich, moderately tannic with notes of cherry, black current and tobacco. Luxurious mouthfeel, smooth finish. I have enjoyed Cos d‚ÄôEstournel wines previously, but this was my first Les Pagodes de Cos- fantastic!

Medium ruby red colour. Pronounced nose with dark plum, blackcurrant, leather tobacco and cinnamon. Pronounced taste of dark plum, blackcurrant, blackberry, leather, tobacco, licorice and cinnamon. Long and dry finish. High acidity. Medium and smooth tannins. Medium body. An very good 2nd wine that really stands out with a lot of punch. Goes well with beef or lamb.

Served with a roast lamb- nothing but sensational. On its own it' has aromas of vanilla and dark fruits. Also having it with a classic magnum. Illuminates the chocolate flavours. This wine is a 2009 edition which reminds me of a  pinnacle moment (more like a song) . I gotta feeling that this wine is gonna be a good wine. Bring more please

Great little second wine. This i found had big espresso and dark chocolate notes. The red berries and cassis was still fresh and blended in nicely. Great vintage, still traveling nicely, not much change in last two years from bottle to bottle and consistency is key! Id say drink now - 2021 while its glamorous.

It‚Äôs the second time that I have this second label of Cos in its superb vintage. In ‚Äò19, it is still very young, tannic and acetic. Good nose, dry and long finish. Black fruits & oak. A good structure suggests its potential. However, I would not open another bottle in the next 5 years time. And for those who have the 99+pointer first label, it would be a crime to open it now.

Plum, blackcurrant, oak and some herb (thyme?) on the nose. Medium+ acidity with smooth tannins. Finishes with cherry and red fruits lingering on the palate. Can't call it a baby Cos because its no infant in flavours & aromas. Good 2nd wine to have considering it's elder siblings price point.
15/01/21

Amazing!  Purchased this wine from a tasting we were lucky enough to be a part of...and then we visited the winery!  Very fortunate for the experience.  Prune, blackberry, and earthy flavours abound in this fabulous Saint-Estephe.

This took quite a while to open up so a wine that needs a good hour to breath before enjoying on this date.

Initially it cleverly hides the fruit and shows more cedar and tobacco notes than fruit. Given some time and the softer vanilla and blackberry notes emerge and continue on the palate.

Personally I think it is a little stretched on the palate and whilst still a very good wine lacking the balance and smooth finish I might expect from Cos.

Just my opinion though.

65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot & 2% Petit Verdot Bordeux blend.

Fruit forward nose with notes of black currant, black cherry, blueberries, and blackberries. There are some hints of vanilla, spice, and cigar box lingering in the back. 

Dry, medium to high acidity, with well rounded, soft tannins just enough to produce a tingling sensation.

Pairs really well with steak.

Age is treating this wine well. Last had about a year ago and I‚Äôm bumping it up .2 points. Still powerful with a strong core of dark fruit and earth. But tannins are more subtle, without making your mouth dry and chalky, which I remember at the end last time. Very nice.

Powerful and concentrated, required the decanter. Blackberry, black currant, prune and liquorice, with graphite, leather and tobacco. Full bodied, ample and acid, with chewy tannins and markedly astringent. On the palate there are confiture, nutmeg, cinnamon, oak and mocha. Prolonged aftertaste

Fabulous! Give me more of this please! Pronounced on the nose with black fruit, blackberry, blueberry and black currant. A lot of oak impact and especially vanilla (very strong), cloves, nutmeg. Herbaceous and herbal aromas emerge after some time in the glass, especially green bell pepper, mint, thyme. Leather and cooked plum complete the spectrum. High acidity and tannins, full body, pronounced on the palate and long finish. What a wine!

Battle of the 2nd wines of super seconds vintage 2010, Croix de Beaucaillou vs Pagodes de Cos. Both opened 3h upfront, not decanted (should have for tje CdB).
CdB: better 2nd day. Opulant and sexy, alcohol present. 
PdC: A bit softer and easier to drink. Longer after taste and a bit more structured.
Both just starting their drinking window. Excellent wines and I‚Äôll purchase some more of both.
CdB: ‚Ç¨50. PdC: ‚Ç¨ 65. On Wine searcher, both average score is 91.
My score: CdB: 4.3. PdC: 4.5.

92 pts. The age of wine does make a difference and here is an example of that. I have tasted this vintage before but didn‚Äôt find it as well as I does now. The wine has got a layer added to the palate so the wine has got some more weight which really helps the performance of this wine now. I do not think this will take another step up as the tannins starts to mellow so drink now.

I bought 2 cases of this on release and am down to just a few bottles now. But based on this tasting, my first for about 5 years, I‚Äôd say we drank the previous bottles way too early!
After an hour in the decanter, the barnyard nose blew away to reveal a relatively complex wine with cassis, dark fruit, oak, leather, chocolate and well integrated tannins. Drink over the next 5 years.

What a Happy Bordeaux week-end üòÅüëçüç∑!

What a treat! This 2nd label from Cos d‚ÄôEstournel & from excellent vintage! Louis Gaspard d‚ÄôEstournel inherited the Cos in 1791 & had a vision to grow the vineyard larger! Blend of 69 CS, 30 Merlot & 1 PV ü§ì! Dark purple hue! Powerful üëÉof plum, cassis, old leather, blackberry. üëÖis üí•! Med acidity, almost smooth tannins, long light length, pepper, anise, blackberry flavours. 4.3üåü! Didn‚Äôt buy cause above psychological üí∞ point for Bordeaux! This üí∞ level reserved for Rh√¥ne üòÅ!

Nose is totally secondary - cigar box and earth.

Big, ripe dark fruit, cassis and bramble, hint of green.  Crisp, with mature, grippy tannin.  Med body, some hollowness mid palate and dryness on edges.  Starting to show its age on med/med+ finish that dries as it lingers.  17+

Dark burgundy red, ruby edge.   Nose show beautiful blackberries, cassis, tobacco leaf, cedar, leather, some cigar box. Palate medium to full bodied, soft fine tannins, medium acidity, very dry, good complexity and finish.

Chateau Cos D‚ÄôEstournel. 2nd wine. Les Pagodes de Cos 2009 vintage. Online tasting with Cornerstone. 

Color: Medium Ruby 

Nose: medium + intensity. Developing.  oak coffee  dark fruit red fruit leather

Palate: Dry. High tannins. Medium acidity and alcohol. Medium + bodied with medium + finish. Flavour intensity is medium +.  cassis blackberry earthy

Quality is Very Good 

Drink now. Potential for aging. 

Less new barrels but a great harvest contributed to good concentration. Very nice!

Brown tinged deep ruby hue. Dark berries on the nose but dominant savoury and liquorice on the nose with a hint of Rosemary. Soft tannins. Initially felt light on the palate but it has really good balance and surprising length. A bit a class and elegance to this...

4.4 My 2nd bottle of this 2nd wine from 2nd growth Cos.  A superb vintage and great bottle.  Packed with flavor in the mid-palate and big acidity yet so balanced.  Michel Reybier owns and runs Cos.  Cos has the only full gravity production cellar in the world.  No pumps.  230 acres at the southern tip of Saint Estephe with 40yo vines.  Big nose of cassis, damp earth, olive tapenade, charcuterie, rosemary, orange marmalade, graphite.  Monster acidity and mid palate with slightly drying tannins.  5 stars soon

J'aime les seconds vins, gage de qualit√©. Les go√ªts sont plus jeunes, mais les bases sont l√†. Fruits noirs, m√ªres et cassis, cuir et chocolat. √âpices. 
A second wine as I like, quality of the first one. Taste a bit young, but the basis are here. Black fruits, blackberry and black currant, leather and chocolate. Spices

Day 1 of Bordeaux, at the wineries restaurant. With visits to Margaux, Pauillac and St. Julien, didn‚Äôt think would also have chance to squeeze in St. Estephe today, so lunch was a good opportunity to try some of their wines. Also a new style!

Had white earlier, and this red offering has more complexity. Heavy on the black fruit - blackberry, plum and black cherry, with leather and some earthy notes. Very enjoyable

Happy Bordeaux Sunday - it‚Äôs a second wine of the super 2eme GC Cos D‚ÄôEstournel. This second has 58% Merlot, 40% Cab Sauv and 2% Pt V. It‚Äôs big brother has the bulk in Cab Sauv. The ‚Äò07 have been good value and on tasting I feel there is still ageing to do here - this was my case plus one bottle which I try to do so I can test age without opening the box

vanilla

4,2 Fine second wine from young wine stocks. Animalistic scent and fine round taste. Good now and can improve a couple of years. Expensive but when the top wine is a Bordeaux 2. Gru then it is the price

Very good. Decant or hold for a few years as it's going to continue to get better. Some leather, light oak and a little fruit. Good acid and very good length. Tannins present now but will become more silky.

Dark red to black colour.
Nose of black fruits, plum, olives, graphite, minerals, green herbs, with hint of wood and oak. 
Full bodied, dry with ripe acidity and velvet tannins. Decent finish of dark fruits and minerals. Always one of the greatest second vin of all time.

Second wine of Ch√¢teau Cos d‚ÄôEstournel... Top 2010 vintage in Saint-Est√®phe... Ripe & powerful, racy tannins, acidity for balance, structure-driven, fruit-defined... Already pleasant to drink now, but should be very long-lived... Great value for money

Don't look down on second wine.

Pungent nose of cassis, sweet licorice, blackberry and raspberry, mushrooms and hint of truffle. 

Palate of supple and ultra silky tannins, caramelized and harmoniously pleasant aftertaste. Dark chocolate, peppers. Lingering and stunning ending! 

It took my breath away!

Deep and dark appearance, very full bodied. Strong plum, black currant and cassis nose, with slightly touches of cedar, coffee and cream. Fruity, savoury tannins and refined finished, it is elegantly powerful one!

Brick red color. Aromas of black currant, dark chocolate, ceddar and a hint of leather. Medium to full bodied, dry, medium acidity with firm matured tannins. If this is second... well we know it. One to savor for a good night with good friends, Classic Bordeaux. Tasted on 04.06.14

Not what I was expecting with this one. I have had older vintages of the main wine and this does not seem like the same estate. Nose is milky or cloudy that makes it seem weak but some raspberries still come through. Palate is soft and offers hard to find raspberries leather and tar. Not bad but not the best showing of a Bordeaux from this year and region.

This was excellent, I‚Äôm not even a big fan of Cos D‚ÄôEstournel, but this second wine at 2007 was perfect to drink now with dark cherries, tobacco and notes of truffle, overall exactly what you‚Äôd expect of a older Bordeaux second wine.

This is how you make wine! Medium garnet. Nose is pronounced black fruit, vanilla, toast, green bell pepper that develop into leather, earthy, medicinal, herbaceous. Dry, high acidity, high tannins, full body and long finish. Awesome, great and well done!

Beautiful! It was no longer "second wine" level! Smooth. Easy to drink. High acidity. Strong tannin feeling. Hint of cassis or blackberry. Full body. Long and balanced finish. I was very surprised it had very sophisticated taste. First attack was very attractive, and I could feel very nice earthy feeling in the aftertaste. Rich and round. Good pairing with grilled salmon.

Earth, spice, blackcurrants, green bell pepper notes, hint of nutmeg. Dry, medium body and tannins, acidity perhaps a tad higher, dried cranberries and prune on the palate. Give the bottle 30 mins to open up. Leather and vanilla notes after breathing.

Following the Sociando we had this horizontal tasting of the 2005 Pagodes. Completely different. Much more fruit power, but also more evolution, as if grapes were picked up a little later. The wine is at its top and I would not wait more than 1 yr to drink at Thai level. Cheers

Oh my. Unusual for me to say this but I think vivino underrates this. At 12 years old it‚Äôs just a wonderful expression of poise & balance. Wonderful coat of mouth feel lingering for an age & a joy to drink, ok a touch of bitter at the end but otherwise it‚Äôs not the individual notes that stand out, but together they‚Äôre an orchestra

Tasted this wine in Saint Emilion along with several others at a wine shop.   
Update: April 2018.  Had a bottle to celebrate my birthday. Paired it with grilled rib steak, shrimp, baked potato and chocolate cake.  It was very good and paired well with the meal.  All the dark fruits were present, cherry, berry and currents.  The wine is big with flavor and very well balanced.

A great super second. Once allowed to breath and open, the Pagodes becomes a great hall mark St Estephe without the heavy price tag of its big brother Cos d'Estournel. The nose is ripe with cassis and black cherry, cedar wood and black truffle. The palate is smooth and supple with that rustic feel you usually get from St Estephe. Vanilla and clove are wonderfully present. The finish is pleasant and leaves you pleased. Enjoyed with Fore Rib of beef and Comte.

I wished it was more tar,graphite and such as that's my style, but it's big, jammy, and definitely a Bordeaux that I believe Napa fans who don't normally buy Bordeaux would change their minds upon having tasted.

3.8pts
#41 wine I tasted at Singapore Wine Fiesta on 20 October.

The grape variety of 2011 : 65% CS, 33% Merlot, 2% Petit Verdot

Med-full body, black berry, spices and leather bouquet, smooth and

In a fantastic place right now. Deep and seductive nose of ripe blackberry, sweet tobacco and leather.

It flows like silk over the palate - incredibly charming and sweet.

To be honest, served blind, I‚Äôd have trouble differentiating this from their first wine.

62% Cabernet, 38% merlot...a nice Bordeaux blend. Medium to full body.  There are noticeable tannins that combines well with the dark berries.  On the nose we have vanilla, pepper and what could be leather...maybe!!!  Though the tannins  are present the finish is silky and dare I say even sweet!!!

Cos d‚ÄùEstournel ‚ÄòPagodes de Cos‚Äô 2009 from the famed Second Growth in Saint-Estephe evolves in a wonderful way in the glass. You get smooth tannins with rich complexity that is impeccably balanced and warms the soul on a level of Bordeaux first wines.  Here you find black currant, blackberry, earth, cinnamon, cigar box, and smoke on the nose, which follows you to the palate along with cream. Dull garnet hued... Light bodied... Full bouquet of leather and berries... Earthy and tobacco notes... Developed and softening tannins... Polished finish medium length... Drink immediately... A bit past its prime...

üëÉmed blackberry, cherry, raspberry w/ emerging anise, vanilla, tad herbal/tobacco note in the end.

Evolving better than 2.5 yrs ago. Good structure & acidic/spicy power, silky textr. Good QPR for < $50. 3+ prime yrs ahead. Better w/ oily foods. 4.3

‚Äò04 vintage. Dark purple centre. Faded hue on the rims. Mild tannins initially. Dark fruit prominent. Plum and cassis. Black cherry in later notes. Well aged for what was not a landmark vintage.  3.8

Tasted the 2009 vintage. Deep black currant and cassis notes give way to a spicy pepper and oak finish that lingers in the mouth far longer than expected. Dry, tannic black fruit skins, this is a meaty, masculine wine.¬† Love the grip, the leathery tones and the tannin.

Delicious right now. Very complex nose. Rasberries, blackberries, casis, wet earth (forrest floor), licorice (Pingvin Saltlakrids) and toasty notes. The aromas are followed through on the medium-bodied palate. Cheers and Merry Christmas to ya all!

3.9 - second time I‚Äôve had the Pagodes 09 I recent time, and it‚Äôs still such a great example of an 09 second wine. Bordeaux out of the gate, pencil shavings, superb fruit with some crunchy yet mellowed tannins keeping it together. It has a lovely core balance with nothing out of place, great dark fruit that has some nice earthy notes to it. Cigar box, slightly meaty and overall medium body. Great bargain wine!

Second wine of the famous Second Cru Class√© Cos d'Estournel in Saint Estephe, Bordeaux.

Comes in a perfect conditions 2010 vintage. 

62% Cab Sauv and 38% Merlot

Complex aromatic nose but be patient, the wine evolves quite significantly in your glass. 

From dark fruit, blackcurrant, plum, cedar and leaves to sweet spices, dark chocolate, coffee bean and minty notes. 
Soft juicy, fruity and jammy attack (sweet feeling) with great freshness and long finish. Quite smooth and round tannins.

Good but nothing remarkable given the pedigree. Drinks under its price point. Was surprised how tight the 2014 vintage was 8 years in given it is supposed to be an early drinking year. Fruit was present but needed a lot of air, even on night 2. Just could never get this out of second gear.

Best wine of the day also tasted blind. I thought new world Bordeaux blend but turned out to be this 2nd wine, albeit disguised by the opening so early in the drinking window. This has at least 5-10 years of improvement in it. Great mouth feel and quality although remaining a bit simple a this stage it is clear this will be a great drink in a few years time. Will buy another and find out!

Tasting @AEON wine bar, Urayasu. Saint-Est√®phe 2014 vintage from Ch√¢teau Cos d'Estournel. Deep ruby, elegant and well developed for a 2014, dark cherry, red and black currant aromas, tobacco, chocolate, wet leather notes and mushroom. Bold, strong but nice bite, dry, powerfuldark fruit and oak on palate, firm tannins, high acidity, good balance, long spicy finish. Good choice for the price.

Deep ruby colour. Aromas of blackberry, blackcurrant, cigar, oak, vanilla, graphite.  Palate is high acidity, medium+ body and alcohol, tannins are therr but not too strong, balance is very good, finish is long.

Already beginning to show some tertiary notes of truffles and leather, and black pepper. In the palate, new notes of chocolate and licorice. Fine tannins provide a silky texture yo accompany the wine‚Äôs freshness.

Aromas of ripe cassis, wet soil, wet tree bark. Some alc. On the nose.

Ripe dark cherries, plums, sweet cassis, blackberries, ripe raspberries, cranberries, ripe blueberries, feels somewhat jammy.
Decent oaky notes, vanilla, leather, tobacco, chocolate, licorice.
Earthy notes, pepper, graphite, wet soil.
Feels somewhat clumsy, plump fruit
Meaty flavors on the finish.
Good acidity, good concentration, good length, grippy young tannic structure.
90-91p

Blackberry and black currants, cassis, some cherry and lighter red fruit. A bit plump. Some spices. Anise and licorice. Green pepper.
Medium acidity, ripening tannins.

Les Pagodes de Cos is the second wine of Cos d‚ÄôEstournel, it was introduced in 1994. The grapes sometimes comes from their other estate Marbuzet, young vines or declassified wines from Cos d‚ÄôEstournel.

This 2010 Les Pagodes de Cos offers a polished oak scent with lots of dark fruits. The structure chain is soft and mellow. Cassis, blackberry, some peppery tones that reminds me of Cote Rotie. The nose is nice and fruity with rough tannins on the palate. Not much complexity, made to be enjoyed young.

88/100

The second wine of Chateau Cos d'Estournel, like the Grand Vin in 2011 it is 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot and the rest Petit Verdot.  I had it with Les Hauts de Pontet-Canet 2011, and I'd put them at about the same quality level, although they are rather different in style.  This Saint-Estephe is more plummy, earthy and gravelly.  The palate has blackcurrant fruit, and more developed notes of prune.  Attractive soft texture, medium + tannins and body, with high acidity.  3.5*+.
Needs +10 years in the cellar to calm down‚Ä¶

De aanzet is droog met medium+ zuren, medium++ tannines, medium+ alcohol, medium++ body en een medium medium/lange afdronk. Op het palet veel complexiteit. Tonen van dadel, blauwe bes, eucalyptus, drop, tijgerbalsem, potlood grafiet, turf, sigaar en toast. Mooie balans en goed op dronk. Deze 2012 heeft nu een mooie balans tussen fris en kruidig.

Dark red with fat texture. Leather, Tobacco  and vanilla in nose. Dry wine with some fruit, yet still tannic, Earthy notes. Good lenght.
This 2006 remind me of a Rhone style wine with a lot of spices. Very intriguing wine. It did get flat fairly quickly. Cheers!
Fine nose and smooth texture. Power has probably already gone a bit here but it is still a nice bottle to go along meat and cheese.
Diluted Bordeaux aroma.  Smooth on the palate, light body.  Good acidity still remain but lost some fruits. Decent second label. Drink now.
A technically well made wine. You wouldnt find much fault with Cos but this lacks the sexiness of many Bordeaux 2003s i have experienced.

From a case I purchased en-primeur. The sun has set on this one. Still showing dark fruits but notes of leather, cedar and tobacco have gained the upper hand here. I waited too long. Drink up!

Es la segunda vez que pruebo esta cosecha de este vino y una calidad muy consistente. Blend de Cabernet Sauvignon con merlot. Con densidad alta, en nariz notas a zarzamoras, moras y chocolate. En boca se aprecia su complejidad, robusto, taninos muy presentes pero redondeas y acidez media alta con buen equilibrio. Final muy frutal. Recomendable.

Bordeaux week continues. Today Saint-Estephe great stuff. Caramel and sweet chocolate on nose says Jane Anson but not Markku S. Graphity, pencil shavings, tar, liguorice and dark berries on nose. Good acidity and bold savoury tannins on palate. Medium plus bodied and medium athletic spicy finish. Paired well with Paullac  and chicken pasta. Decanded an hour. Benefits of cource cellaring but was very well drincable today too.

Out of the wines that we had on French Wine night, this is the one that got my attention. After an hour in the decanter, it achieve a nice balance of red fruit + pleasant green notes (think mint/sage). A bit more umph than others it's age, it's made me want to look more in Saint-Estephe area wines...

Majestic rich aromas of fig and plum on an elegant intense dark red color. Intriguing juicy taste with mild acidic tones follows a prolific but skillfully restrained bold mellow sweetness that only makes you want more.

Second line of cos d‚Äôestournel. Very smooth - long finish - relaxing - nose is good but u gotta really inhale. 

Tried d‚Äôestournel before but I feel this is a good plot and a good value for its price.

A bourdeaux presentation that fell short. The fruit was subdued, there was plenty earthiness and honestly not too much else. The tannins were mild , as was the acidity. Not much excitement here, sadly.

A decent luncheon selection, drinking just about perfectly. Served slightly chilled, well we were eating on the terrace and it is 34c, so it tasted actually quite refreshing. Beautiful fruit and well balanced. Low acidity sonic you have some, I would not wait too long. Cranberry cassis and some plum notes. Smooth aftertaste. No tannins. Good value in Cos second tier product which would be hard to tell from the chateau version.

4.25
Deep dark red. Red fruit, potent. Cherries and plum on the nose. Finesse. 

The taste is with great acidity, fresh fruit and mellow tannins. An hour decanting helps a lot. Was afraid it was closed but Air helps. 

Great glass! Youthful but great drinkability.

Very powerful and full-bodied wine. I fully agree with Jack Madrid's review.  This is exactly the case when 2nd wine is better than the first wines of other houses. Very bright red fruits, layered with wonderful tannins! Very long aftertaste! 
Very recommend!
Cheers!

4.7. An elegant wine. Pedigree over pretense. This may be a "second" wine but I'm happy to be able to pay under $100 for a Cos d'Estournel wine. Smooth/Velvet tannins, slightly sweet but refined black currants, mulberry (can't remember all my tasting details). Long finish straight through the back of the palate without filling outward. It's easy to drink, but in an impressive and sophisticated way.

Absolute steal! If the 2nd wine is of this quality, I can only imagine the magic of the first when ready. Power and intensity comes to mind with notes of black fruit, vanilla, tobacco, licorice, mushrooms, cocoa, cigar box, violet, rosemary and forest floor on the nose. The tannins are silky with just the right amount of acid to maintain balance. Medium plus body that befits her intensity and finally finishing strongly. I can‚Äôt help but say this surpasses some of the first wines from less stellar vintages.

Crimson red rim with a dark blackish core.
The scent of fresh cassis and smoky tobacco. 
Palate was lively with fleshy red and black currant fruits and vibrant acids, graphites and minerals. While the tannins are still firm today, it is still approachable with food.
It will probably be even better in another 5 years.

almost perfect
less length and complexty from top cuve
And less amount of tannin also gives less potential for aging.
oaky vanilla based on fruit and keep elegance.
If I drink it in restaurant it can be very good wine.

Classy!

Massive perfume here of sweet spice, black fruit and damp earth, couldn‚Äôt stop swirling this wine!

I loved the sweet, luscious cherry note at the start which becomes more menthol and liquorice at the finish. Delicious wine.

Young vines, young tasting.   Would benefit from more aging but still solid to drink now.  Palate was soft and fruit-forwarded but balanced well with tobacco prevalent.  62% Cab/38% Merlot...might have been the least "enjoyable" in a great lineup, but still a solid wine, on par for its price point. 
VIP Concierge Tasting (5 of 11)

Savory aromas. Cherry and tobacco palate. Soft tannins, med-low acid, and full bodied. Great value and age-worthy wine!

5/9/2020 update: RIP Little Richard.
On the nose it‚Äôs rich with plum and waxy red tree fruit. Dried prune and cherry on the palate with cinnamon stick and black licorice. Clay minerality abounds. Paired phenomenally with a flap steak and chimichurri sandwich. Enjoyed with Kayla :)

Ruby-colored baby.  Needs about an hour to start opening up but worth the wait.  Flavors of Redcurrant, cassis, fresh mushrooms and oak with impeccable balance and firm tannins.  This will develop very nicely over the next 5-10 years.

4.1. Very good Left Bank Bourdeaux from the legendary St. Estephe winery Cos d'Estournel. (This is their sec Cassis, blackberry, vanilla, chocolate, a little tobacco, and some herbs and a touch of kalamata olive on the nose. Palate brings in some green herbaceous notes. Firm tannins. Nice long finish.

Equivalent to a 7-foot Center drafted #1 by flailing NBA team, hoping that years of development will bring about optimal performance and raise stock of entire organization (vineyard). Ripe red fruits and tobacco-heavy palate make it quite enjoyable, eventual upgrade to 5 stars inevitable. Like gifting Stephen King's infamous horror novel a Rolex--just give it time.

Very good wine. It starts with purple and blood red colors depending on the lighting, fascinating. Pleasant (strong) complex smell. The first sip gives a touch of spice and earthyness. Its dry with a good acidity. Kind of minerally texture that is not in the mood yet to be smooth to your mouth. It needs some time to reveal its complexity but excellent profile. Really powerful wine

This wine has plenty of aromas mainly black berry and black currant. The scent was very complex and there were hints of leather and fallen leaves coming from subtle aging.
Tannin was relatively smooth and balanced with the fruitiness.

Star of the night in a 2009-10 left bank mini-tasting.  Star anise and green pepper nose, smooth black currant and blueberry opening, later loads of strawberry on the nose. Tiny tannins, smooth, lingers. Drinking perfectly right now. Great vfm.

WMK'sTB.
Wow really tight w/spicy oriental pepper nose!

Black fruits, smoke  bell peppers graphite dominate a very gritty muscular body of robust tannins that took hours to soften, then the textured elegance, voluptuous layers segued in, smoke, coffee, mint licorice dances on still astringent palate into a linger long finale, close to 1 min! 

4.2‚òÜ great vintage powerful. Need real patience with this relatively young powerful vintage! 2nd wine of Cos!

Zoom wine tasting exchange with SKT MV WMK 20.04.2020!

Ruby, on the nose, it is so mature, Forrest floor, warm bread, chocolate, blueberry jam, mushroom, on the palate, velvet tanning, right on the peak I think, finishes with leather and tobacco. It's a super star

Rich earthy forest aromas, with plummy, oaky vanilla notes on the nose 

Plums and vanilla infused cherries  come through on the palate, silky smooth tannins, perfectly balanced acidity.

A med+ finish, full of subtle oaky vanilla flavours with a touch smoke. 

My first saint. Esteph and it definitely won‚Äôt be my last!

This wine is a clear deep ruby.

The nose is clean & pronounced. Aromas of blackcurrant, blackberry, bramble, plum, vanilla, clove & cedar.

The palate is dry with high acidity and med + alcohol. The tannins are med, smooth and fine grained. It has a med + body and a long finish. The intensity is pronounced and follows from the nose.

Outstanding wine. The acidity and fruit intensity balances thy e alcohol level, the finish is long and it is developing in complexity. Drinking now and will age further.

4,25....(Vivino BA .... please....) 
Going towards brickcolour....
Clear notes of blackcurrant, cedar, eucalyptus and some tobacco.
Well integrated tannins, long aftertaste with dark mintchocholate, tobacco and bayleaf.

Such intensity! Blackberry, leather and oak. The notes are so tight that I wish I could have given it another few hours to open up. With this tannin and acidity, would def grow with a few years more time in the bottle. 

P.S. oh the wine finally opened at towards the very last sips - almost 2 hours in the decanter! Tannins became much smoother with harmonious notes of a pot of cooked berries and spices. Raising it to a 4.5 now.

This is 3rd and last bottle of the night ( with just 3 of us ) üòä. We already tipsy and lucky we choose this one to end. The fragrant of the French perk us up and we finish the night in style and go home a happy man!
Still drinking very well!

Second time I had this wine in a few days time. Elegant, layered and bold and mighty. Both on the nose and on the palate dominated by flavors of earth, clay, tobacco box and wood, with some cassis as well. Quite dry and high in tannins, with the typical robustness of a Saint-Est√®phe.

This is still drinking perfectly! Maybe a bit too much barn and leather straight after opening, but 30 min on it opened beautifully. Very balanced and good length. Color is deep red with cassis, cedar and cigarbox nose. Very good second wine indeed!! 20 years and rocking.

Merci Claudie & Merci la Vie!!
This bad boy St-Estephe is ready to drink, perfectly integrated, silky tannins, started with black fruits (blackberries & prune) and moved to red fruits after 1 hour (strawberries & red cassis). Lots of spices, some butter and long rich finish.
Wow

After tasting through what can only be described as a celebration of mediocrity in Bordeaux terms over the past couple of weeks I felt tantalised but wanted a banker.

This was a wine I remember being almost impenetrable the first time I tried it a few years ago, then absolutely bang on two years ago and now a little tired trying it this year.

It‚Äôs still bloody lovely and Bordeaux-aplenty with notes of cassis, old leather and cedar but you do see the difference in pedigree between the second wine & the grand vin.

Lovely St Estephe.
Aroma when opened/pouring very nice, thick viscous body on pouring.
Cherry, leather, oak, on the forefront.
A decent medium length finish. 
Certainly a winner and one I‚Äôd happily buy again. 4.25 ‚≠êÔ∏è

Legs that linger, oak and dark berries and cherries on the nose. Sweet berries on the palet with a soft mildly tart finish. I'm a bit concerned about the fairly strong oak notes for a St. Esteph. Over time, strong cassis notes arise.
Given time, very rounded chewy tannins. Very enjoyable.

Beautiful wine. Silky smooth, but powerful. Deep opaque purple in the glass, the nose is all earth, both upon opening and several hours after decanting. Leather, wood, barnyard floor, flint, dust, with just a hint of fruit backbone. Palette is austere but smooth as mentioned - subtle and sophisticated with earth as dominant, but more dark fruit than the nose would indicate. Finish is mouth-drying tannin heavy, with the same earth over fruit style. This wine still has time to mellow.
Red fruit, rich mulberry, silky tannins, black currants, full bodied, opulent, sweet

What a delightful second wine we have here and how powerful these 09‚Äôs can be! Delightful nose of green herb with petrol and leather. Such a soft mouthfeel, this has been enjoyed over 4 hours with 6 hours air but still lots of grip is evident! A long warming finish of winter fruit and vanilla! Good pick @[1|19828354|Paul Davies]! 4 stars for sure.

Almost same good as the first wine of Cos. Very rich nose, deep and elegant, typical Bordeaux notes, cherry, leather, blackcurrant leaves, wild berries, black pepper, hard to stop to enjoy that lovely bouquet. Taste is more simple comparing to its father but still can be enjoyed. Medium body and acidity, low tannins, cranberry and lingonberry on aftertaste. Very decent wine for its price!

Improved significantly since the last bottle. Deep ruby red with no ageing signs. Menthol and wood on the nose.  Slim legs. Fruit, oak, vanilla in the mouth. All integrated. Tannins soft and velvety. Good length and weight.
Leathery Bordeaux with a lot of tannins, nevertheless a delightful second wine of this ch√¢teau. Goes a treat with foie gras. Notes of chocolate.

Fantastic bottle, rich fresh dark fruit, black currant, blackberries, licorice, earthy, pipe tobacco, and French oak. Deep complex nose, every time you smelled the wine you would get more complex notes than before that evolved so much. Grab a bottle cheers!!!

Appearance:deep ruby, crimson, no discernible rim.Nose: dark fruit,incense,eucalyptus,cigar box, hint of pepper.Palate:blackberry, blackcurrant, cassis, rare meat,pepper,dark chocolate,vanilla  and a hint of liquorice(sweet).Full bodied,fantastically supple mouthfeel, really opulent.Totally delicious right now, yet has sufficient structure to cellar for at least another 10 years or more (if you can resist it!).Decanted for three hours and served at 17-20 degrees C. Mar 2015

Nose shows blackberry, eucalyptus, umami and dried forest floor.  Dry, medium acid and super soft and luxurious tannins.  Med body and layered flavors of the same. Gorgeous wine and definitely at 14 yrs old higher than RP's 89pts score.  Easily 93pts based on what is in the glass.

2nd bottle for the day. One of the most popular red from Saint-Estephe. Have pretty high expectations on this before it open. This full body red comes with plum raspberry mushroom and blackberries. Silky tannins with savory finish. Better around 2019. 89/100

Modest on the nose - conifer, mineral, hints of cheese, little dark fruits. Garnet. Medium bodied, good structure, gentle tannins, pronounced dark fruits, cedar, some smoke, good length. Harmonious, good length - very enjoyable

A big wine. Dark inky colour. Left to decant for a couple of hours but would have benefited from 2 more-just couldn't wait! Nose opened up a bit with pleasant but restrained classic Bordeaux cassis. On the palate highly structured powerful wine with a long finish. Plenty of fruit and I am sure will be even better if you give it 3-5 more years in the bottle.

Bright garnet not too much age on the rim. The blue has gone but it is 12 years old. Decent blackfruit and some leaf on the nose.   The palate has fruit but there are still powerful tannins that are maintained across the palate and in the finish. It still has more time to give in my humble opinion. Decent wine. It was a delight with a piece of rare beef this evening üòÄ

Why 4 , because we didn't let it age enough. Still delicious . Herbal underbrush on the nose. On the palate, this is still a very austere wine and needs 10 more years, but alas, we were doing a Bordeaux tasting. Steong tannic structure, black currant,  dried fruit and so good

Bottle 2 (1st was corked). Opaque garnet, slight brick edge. Nose has all that was promised but the TCA hid, blackcurrant, bramble, cedar, smoke. Palate is fresh and lively, ripe blackcurrant, green apple bite, cedar, slight roast meat umami, ripe grippy tannin. Hint of sweet vanilla on the long finish. Drinking well, no hurry. 17.75/20. 92/100. #frenchwine #riedel #bordeaux #saint-estephe #bordeaux #winetasting
Chocolate, blackberries, cedar, oak, grass, vanilla, ash.

It lacks some elegence for me. The alcohol is a little bit too high with very mature fruit. I should give it less than four starts.

Mmmm aged to perfection. Lovely dark red nearly brown colour. Lots of oak on the nose and wet old forest smells. First sips, dry start then a load of forest fruits then they are pushed aside by a great finish of strong alcoholic like flavours. Really love this great wine.

Dark complex bouquet of sweet cassis blackberry with smoked earth, coffee, tobacco, leather, caramel. In the mouth very concentrated, warm with explosive burning alcohol, but super smooth tannins and nice thick texture with lots of dark jammy prune and cherry. Super power wine with delicious dark fruit and tertiary tones.

Friday wine at work a couple of days ago. Really high performing second wine, it can be felt that Cos d'Estournel has made massive investments in cellars and how much JG Prats did for the chateau during his time there. Quite fruit forward in style, this is a very big and opulent wine with plenty of cassis, blackberry jam, spice (vanilla, nutmeg, cloves) and wet tobacco. St. Estephe earthiness also present. Rich and complex wine, I suggest further cellaring - though it drinks fine, if you like them young.

Second label from the prestigious Cos D'Estournel located in Saint Estephe near Lafite & Mouton. The soil is nearly all pebbles - I've held it - even tasted it! It's true. The 09 is approachable because 09 was a goldmine in Bordeaux - intense aromatics of perfumed raspberry, but will take time to expose the soil! Why do we drink French wine!?! Because their soil is their treasure! Strangely very little tannic argumentation and a LOT of bright fruit. Lay it down and let it sleep!

85/100

One of my first 2011 in Bordeaux. I will need to try a few more to really picture the vintage. This St Estephe is a little overpowered by alcohol on the nose, with a hint of mint at the back end. The palate is dominated by a green tinge, which isn‚Äôt unpleasant. The aromatics aren‚Äôt fully developed, the feel and texture are a little austere, and the wine dissolved rather than finishes at this stage. Need a little more time?

2nd wine of one of the 2 2nd Growth of Saint Est√®phe - the beautiful Cos d'Etournel.50% CS,50% Merlot.Dark ruby colour with a slight brownish shimmer.Nose initially a bit flat with only some oxidised notes.Rapidly improving, dark berry fruits appear, then leather,smoke,toast and a bit of chocolate.Medium bodied with powerful rough tannins.Taste has dark fruits,leather and led pencil.Acidity seems to be not fully integrated.Overall enjoyable,but not great,and possibly no improvement is to be expected.
86 pts

A little green, leaving a rather noticeable bitter mouthfeel. Also a tad high on alcohol and acidic on the palate. Medium to full bodied wine and rather tannic and austere. That said, a nice wine with structure, if somewhat harsh. Notes of leather, blackcurrants and vanilla.

Went well with pasta and chicken; and later solo. Needed 1 hr. to decant - too much alcohol in nose & mouth in first bottle. It smoothed out more with time (3rd bottle decanted @ 2nd hr.) - yielding increasingly nice berry bouquet starting betw 1-2 hrs. I prefer heavier oak & tannin reds - I will say happily though: this was a nice, medium bodied wine, primarily strawberry on the pallet, smooth swish and finish. It went over very well with my guests!  Thanks Aficionados on Vivino for the recommendations!

Dark ruby. Nose of incense, spice and a whiff of heat (alcohol)! On the palate, this was structured. Dark fruits, meaty and spicy with gripping tannins. Beautiful elegant wine. Double decanter 3 hours before drinking. Deep ruby to purple. Elegant medium perfume on the nose with black fruits and black cherry, hints of vanilla and spice and mushroom. Notes from a Piemonte tasting in the club. Now over to a flight of 2007 PdB Riserva. Very popular wines up here the last years, the 2017 vintage disappeard very quickly after release yesterday. I can sort of see why, the price is still pretty consistent compares to other quality nebbiolo the last years. Nice nose a bit more subtle than the Ovello. Earthy, oak. On the palate it is still powerful, intense, full-bodied, strong licorice, dark sour fruit, strong tannins. Good! But needs time still.

Tons of dark berries fused with leather, cedar, earthy mushrooms, bitter chocolate. It started slow with earthy and leather tones, after some airtime and pairing with food it opened with beautiful berries, cedar and chocolate.

Excellent Barbaresco Riserva; opened up nicely with time to breathe; (2008 was a cooler vintage); great complexity that developed over hours; primary: cherry, wild berry; secondary: tobacco, leather, earth floor; tertiary: cinnamon, spice, cooked fruit;@Il Centro, Priocca, Piemonte, IT

At 10, this hits the sweetspot between youth and maturity. The rather warm vintage is evident from the sweetness of pruney fruit and some heat on the finish, but there is impressive depth and complexity to match. Dried rose petals, cherries, wax, anise and some minty herbs and underbrush. Big and bold palate, with very good length and plenty of structure for the long haul, but I rather like it now...

@[1|47623479|Blind Faith] Produttori 2011s. I'm yet to taste the Muncagota that convinces me it deserves a place among Produttori's 9 Riservas. The vineyard faces southeast on the ridge between Rabaja and Montestefano. In isolation it is a reasonable Barbaresco; in this line up it falls flat. Nose of red cherry, violet and leather. The structure is middle of the range for these wines, prune, mint, earth, undergrowth, tobacco. Sadly it lacks the concentration, complexity or grace of the other Riservas.

Really liked this one in the lineup. 2011 was probably the best vintage for Muncagota, tannins similar to montefico, but more floral. Highest vineyard and South West facing. Bt 1210/16,666. All of the Single Vineyards are made the same way, so the only difference is the terroir. 28 days maceration period, all malolactic fermentation, then 36 months in big barrels that can be up to 40 years old, and then 12 months in bottle to rest before release. Another single Cru from this great producer. Darker red fruit than many of the other Cru's. Most developed 2008 I've tried so far. Lovely nose with coffee, leather, cedar, chocolate and tobacco. Dense and powerful palate, nice acidity but slightly bitter finish. Develops nicely in the glas, nose opening up after an hour. Finished the bottle to quickly, got the feeling it might have had more to give with more air.

Memories. I opened this bottle when I became a sommelier! 

Large nose, with a predominance of violet and red fruits. Important acidity, drinkability high-impact, crisp, soft and persistent...I would have drank the whole bottle

#PriddlesProduttoriPouches - a 7-wine tasting of the entry level Barbaresco plus 6 crus. This is a South/East facing vineyard getting cooler morning sun. The most floral/herbal nose for me - rose, oregano, mint leaf. Grippy tannins carrying red summer fruit and menthol palate. Strangely it seemed to evolve in reverse in the glass, with the initial fruit/floral aromas training quite dusty and coffee nuanced...the opposite of how most of the other opened up.

91 points. Vintage 2009 opened in 2021.

A more complex riserva... on the nose, both mineral (wet stones) and dark stone fruit. Very beautiful in the mouth, with great complexity, elegance, and body and noticeable, but balanced tannins. Can't wait to see this wine in 20 years!
Wild strawberries and raspberries...bright red...playfully and joyful

Continuing with Produttori 2011 tasting organised by @[1|47623479|Blind Faith]. It is a lovely Barbaresco but the line up is simply exceptional. This one does come up as a crowd pleaser with more of fruity, less complexity coming through. Med garnet, med+ intensity with dusty red cherry, violet, dusty leather, hibiscus tea leaf, dehydrated raspberry and menthol. It is lovely, but something is missing!

üëÅ med garnet. üëÉ med+ intensity, red cherry, dried raspberry, violet, leather, eucalyptus.

Dry. Med body & alcohol. High acidity. High tannins. üëÖ med+ intensity, more red fruit, tobacco, tea leaf, trompette mushroom.

A fairly herbacious fella, quite tangy too and a more alcoholic mouthfeel than its neighbours from the same area. Still there are nice flavours to be found - toasted wood, strawberries and sage. Definitely winning the indigenous badge when it comes to being truthful to the local spirit of style.

Nebbiolo monday. PdB riserva Muncagota  retasting from last june. Exactly same notes. Shy on nose. Dark cherries, slighly strawberries, liguorice and balsamico on nose. Still grippy acidity and athletic mouthdrying tannins with dark cherries on palate. Quite grippy long spicy finish. Quality barbaresco but needs longer cellaring.

Produttori #5 and I think we all struggled with this one a little more than the others. As Robbie noted, this was the only bottle in the seven to show any sediment and even if this wine did mellow with time in the glass, it never really escaped feeling tertiary. There was notably less expression of fruit and it felt quite meaty (Andy B called charcuterie nicely) with a lot more iron/ grip/ almost farmyard than might have been expected. Definitely the outlier, though it may have been a bad bottle?

I found the tannins to be quite dusty and not as appealing as other wines. Fairly persistent but more developed than other wines here, and maybe a touch washed out. 

I suspect it would have shown marginally better if not in a lineup with the other 2007s.

Big, broad, beautiful Barolo.  This is a more masculine version of nebbiolo with some dark fruits thrown into the usual red cherry, strawberry, tar, and tobacco.  It's still a baby, and the tannins let you know it.  But as this ages it is going to become absolutely phenomenal.  Buy a 6 pack and open one up every 5 years until you just can't hold off anymore.  Drink 2024 - a long time from in the distant future.

Nose: Violet and rose petal, some lilac with raspberry, fresh strawberry, and oak cedar, minerals, clay pot. More floral and earthy than the Bricco delle Viole.
Palate: Red fruits/raspberry lead into violet, thyme, with exotic spices, then ends in a long rose water, cherry, and earthy finish. Full bodied, high acid, high amount of velvety tannins. Fantanstical and balanced. Approachable. Best 2023+. 92 points.

A delicious but youthful Barolo from a south-facing MGA vineyard near Novello. Clean, complex, with med (+) black cherry, ripe plum, tar, rose, coffee, licorice.  Dry, but with lots of sweet fruit.  Med (+) acidity, pronounced tannins and high alcohol (14%). The palate is richer, more complex and more extracted than the Bricco delle Viole.  It is showing a lot more oak influence.  Quite age-worthy, it will reward long-term cellaring.

Ravera is a top site in Barolo's Novello commune. The soils have low fertility, with an iron-rich mix of clay and sand. 2010 is Vajra's first vintage. Vajra bought the plot in 2000, replanted in 2001, and initially used the grapes for Langhe Nebbiolo.

This is a big wine, mineral and metallic. Spice, vanilla, cedar. The palate is austere, more minerality and structure than fruit at the moment. Some red berries, balsamic, tobacco. Youthful, intense and persistent. Needs at least 5 more years in bottle. 4*+.

Drink now or age for 3 to 4 more years. Interested in trying more stuff from ravera. The tannin and acidity is still quite high for ‚Äò14 vintage. Definetely doesn‚Äôt slow build like other Barolo. Is very subtle and then punches. Nose quite mineral and soft. Palate is leather a bit of tar and then raspberry, black plum and red cherry. Not getting that classic tobacc that I love or dusty tannin in Barolo. More austere but interesting, not meaty but still powerful. Really complements heavier red-sauce dishes

Despite its youth,the floral and red fruit nose underpinned with earthy notes is enthralling and promising.The palate is initially delicate - red currant, cherry and tobacco.Medium bodied with secondary notes of forest floor and hint of leather. Some grippy tannins on the medium-long, drying finish suggest that this is a work in progress that will reward patience. One to buy and lay down - I reckon another 8 to ten years and this wine will be fully integrated and balanced with tertiary notes to relish. Mmmm
Excellent Barolo...tanins under control. Elegant wine
3.7 Deep Garnet in color. Soft, refreshing nose of raspberry and vanilla with a light touch of oak and dried herbs. Cherry and black licorice on the palate followed by gritty tannins.

I don‚Äôt get the attraction to Barolo. After a string of iconic MR reds we had this. Was extremely delicate. Like a watered down NZ pinot. Strawberry‚Äôs and cherry nuances. But not much more than that and a gentle mouth drying sensation. Similar to most Barolo‚Äôs I‚Äôve tried. IMO Italian reds are either extremely subtle and uninteresting or ball-busting 16%+ amorone style borderline ports. Similar views expressed by others in the tasting group, except for the guy who brought the Barolo who seemed to enjoy it.

Cherry, leather and Aniseed and a little bit of smoke in the nose. Nice acidity that starts strong but then drops away to let the tannin carry through. Medium finish that doesn‚Äôt develop much at this stage.

Happy Nebbiolo Monday! This is a delicious wine. Garnet red body with orange tinged rim. Dry herbs and spice with red fruit on the nose. Dried cranberry-cherry, piney black tea and a wisp of smoke. Well blended tannins and acidity for a mineral rock finish with a touch of fruit coming back. Very nice wine 4.3 for me!

Can't wait to keep it longer, me and Barolo problems. Huge tannins and medium acidity,a decanter would help sort this out! Nose is filled with stewed fruits, cherries and rose petals while palate got fruity, jammy notes which pretty much sums up this as a textbook Barolo!

Barolobrunello, second wine was this single wineyard barolo Ravera 12'. Similar notes like on the previous wine except that this one was more closed and spicy. 
Medium ruby colour. 
Sharp metal mineral, minty nose, splashed with fresh cherry and blueberry jam perfumes. 
On palate, fresh with high acidity, medium+ body and big tannins. Not that elegant like previous wine but not far away. Similar flavor, sweet spicy, berry fruity aromas. Finish is long and fruity. It needs a lot of cellaring.

My first Barolo from G.D. Vajra is this young Ravera 2012. It boasts a very juicy berry fruit that mingles with wild flowers, rose petals, spices, camphor, and a bit of ash and rust on the intense and mineral finish. The structure is potent almost muscular by way of a brilliant acidity and grippy tannins. With aeration it gains complexity but more will definitely develop during further cellaring. In summary, a great glass of virile Barolo in a fresh and cool style. Ravera is an MGA in Novello.

Renowned Barolo from a great year. Single vineyard and aged for 32 months in Slavonian oak. The aroma rises like steam to envelope you. The pallet builds slowly but inexorably towards an overwhelming climax of dark berries, tobacco, and mushrooms. A complex profile of spices both autumnal and oriental lurks close by. The style is modern and thus more fruit focused, but the aggressive tannins still make their presence felt.

This wine exhibits an overload of vanilla, woodiness and bitterness on the nose. Not surprisingly, the palette is overwhelmed by vanilla, however, loads of good fruits are masked behind the oak, I think it'll take many years to reach some harmony of balance of fruits and oak.

dark ruby red, blend of 90% Merlot and 10% Cab Franc. Intense nose with ripe black plums. Juicy palate, plums follow through on the palate with slightly chewy tannins. Would recommend to enjoy with a steak to carry the otherwise chewy tannins. Keep for another 3-4yrs.

Made with 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, deep burgundy color, definitely an early drinking candidate, nose smells of menthol, black plum, cassis, charcoal, clay, eucalyptus, soy sauce, licorice, clove, and cigar box, full body with balanced acidity and refined tannin, tastes of cassis, blackcurrant, blueberry, tobacco, dark chocolate, licorice and hazelnut, very smooth and soothing, lacking some distinctive character but a tasty wine nevertheless.

Great for a Monday Merlot fix. 90% merlot, 10% Cab Franc.
Pretty standard dark ruby Bordeaux color.
Nose offers dark berries and earthy aromas. 
On the palate much more of a red fruit than black,  red cherry, dense raspberry, some plum, and graphite supported by a solid oak structure.
Pretty chewy tannins in the long finish.

Deep ruby with purple hue.    Mediam plus intensity on the nose, notes of mocha dominates upfront, follow by cigar box, eucalytus, blackberries, and spices.  Hints of violets.  Elegant palate, velvety, well-rounded without an overbearly weight (very merlot dominant).  Relatively balanced, integrated tannins and alcohol, need time for it to fully open to enjoy the full dynamic characteristics.

(4.1) An aroma of leather, earth, red berries, and a hint of vanilla. Between a dark and bright red in color. Black cherry and hint of strawberries and spice on the palate. Soft, velvety and round mouth feel with good tannins. Smooth and well balanced, maybe even better in a year or two. It‚Äôs a dry wine with a medium long finish.

Velvety, Oaky, berry, fishy(roasted salmon skin?), truffle aroma some sage and pine. Smell reminds me of Vieux Donjon. Light body and mouthfeel. Juicy. Sour at the back of the tongue. Pretty grippy. Better to smell than drink.

Mouthfeel was full, creamy lush texture, very supple but nicely integrated but plush body. Expressive,fresh focused acidity, muscular chewiness. Long sl sour finale of smoke, freshcut oak, but dry.

4.35 right bank at its best, ofcourse in medium budget. 35 euro in leclerc warsaw few years ago was a bargain. In nose raspberry and figs. A lot of figs. Then some oak and blackberries on a paleate. Still clearly feel figs. Complex and ready to drink. Beautiful merlot ! Recomend.

Second bottle opened 2022. Still young, but now a solid 4.0; latex has turned into dried leaves. Tannins have integrated better. Additional cocoa and chocolate on the finish. Still better with a hard decanting. Could use several more years in bottle. 

3.75. Opened 2020. Still young. Fruit, capsicum, hints of tobacco and latex on the nose. Light Cherry, plum, blueberry, flint palate. Light acids and chalky tannins. Needs decanting to open.

Deep purple color. On the nose this wine really attracts me, elegant dark red fruits, plum, elegant, cool, smooth. On the palate the first impression from the nose goes on. There is more, complexity, elegance, fine grained tannins, herbs and a med to long finish.

First day: blackberry, barnyard and chocolate. On the palate light but nice texture. Medium length. 90 GP
Day two: wild berries, blackberries and strawberries. No barnyard anymore. Very fresh fruit here, sexy and sweet with just a hint of vanilla. On the palate nice blackberries with dark chocolate. Quite low acidity but not sweet or sticky. Medium length of a very nice Merlot. 92 GP

Decanted for 2+ hours. This is still quite close and would benefit from another 3-5 years in the cellar. I could not detect any developed tertiary flavours, and the lingering finish does not quite deliver the expected complexity.

3.8pts
